name: Berberis aquifolium mahonia
Relationship: Carbol. acid; Euonym; Berb. vulg.; Hydr.

Head: Sensation of a band just above ears
Bilious headache
"Scald head
" Scaly eczema
Stomach: Tongue thickly coated, yellowish-brown; feels blistered
Stitching, crampy pains; thick mucus, and bright-red, mealy sediment
Skin: Eruption on SCALP EXTENDING TO FACE and neck

details: A remedy for the skins, chronic catarrhal affections, secondary syphilis. Hepatic torpor, lassitude and other evidences of incomplete metamorphosis; stimulates all glands and improves nutrition.
